subject: Medicine
title: Drug Pricing Ethics
description: Learn Drug Pricing Ethics in one minute.

hook.text: A lifesaving cancer drug costs $100,000 per year. It costs $100 to manufacture. Who decides the price?

buildup.text: Pharmaceutical companies set prices based on development costs, patents, and what markets will bear.

discovery.text: Patents give 20-year monopolies to incentivize innovationâ€”but can price patients out of lifesaving treatments.

twist.text: Many breakthrough drugs were developed using taxpayer-funded researchâ€”then sold back to the public at huge markups.

climax.text: Balancing innovation incentives with affordable access is one of medicine's most urgent ethical challenges.

punchline.text: A cure you can't afford isn't really a cure.

quiz.question: Why are drug prices ethically controversial?
options: Patents allow monopoly pricing that can block patient access
All drugs cost the same amount to manufacture
Pharmaceutical companies never invest in research
